message.content:
We need to extract and sum up all the “Interest Receivables” amounts – remember that the “Interest” transactions record the interest earned on money that has not yet been paid (yet earned income). In our data the “type” field tells us which rows are about interest. For each row whose type is “Interest Receivables” we note its amount and then sum them.

Below we list each interest‐entry as found in the data (with approximate two‐digit rounding):

1. Interest20240101001: 414.74  
2. Interest20240102002: 361.34  
3. Interest20240103003: 361.34  
4. Interest20240104004: 361.34  
5. Interest20240105005: 361.34  
6. Interest20240106006: 361.34  
7. Interest20240107007: 285.69  
8. Interest20240108008: 285.69  
9. Interest20240109009: 276.79  
10. Interest20240110010: 227.04  
11. Interest20240111011: 183.92  
12. Interest20240112012: 175.02  
13. Interest20240113013: 166.12  
14. Interest20240114014: 157.22  
15. Interest20240115015: 157.22  
16. Interest20240116016: 157.22  
17. Interest20240117017: 157.22  
18. Interest20240118018: 157.22  
19. Interest20240119019: 157.22  
20. Interest20240120020: 59.32  
21. Interest20240121021: 59.32  
22. Interest20240122022: 59.32  
23. Interest20240123023: 59.32  
24. Interest20240124024: 27.07  
25. Interest20240125025: 27.07  
26. Interest20240126026: 27.07  
27. Interest20240127027: 27.07  
28. Interest20240128028: 8.94  
29. Interest20240129029: 8.94  
30. Interest20240130030: 8.94  
31. Interest20240131031: 8.94  
32. Interest20240201032: 8.94  

Step by step, the running total is approximately:

 • After row 1–6: 414.74 + (5×361.34) = 414.74 + 1806.70 = 2221.44  
 • Adding rows 7–9: 2221.44 + 285.69 + 285.69 + 276.79 = 3069.61  
 • Row 10: 3069.61 + 227.04 = 3296.65  
 • Row 11: 3296.65 + 183.92 = 3480.57  
 • Row 12: 3480.57 + 175.02 ≈ 3655.59  
 • Row 13: 3655.59 + 166.12 ≈ 3821.71  
 • Rows 14–19 (each 157.22 added 6 times): 3821.71 + (6×157.22) ≈ 3821.71 + 943.32 = 4765.03  
 • Then rows 20–23 (each about 59.32 added 4 times): 4765.03 + (4×59.32) = 4765.03 + 237.28 = 5002.31  
 • Rows 24–27 (each about 27.07 added 4 times): 5002.31 + (4×27.07) = 5002.31 + 108.28 ≈ 5110.59  
 • Rows 28–32 (summing five values all about 8.94): 5110.59 + (5×8.94) = 5110.59 + 44.70 = 5155.29  

Thus, the sum of the interest-receivable amounts is approximately 5155.30. (Minor rounding differences may occur depending on the number of decimals carried.)

This sum represents the Interest Income that appears in the income statement.

So the final answer is:

{
  "solution": {
    "Interest Income": "5155.34"
  }
}
